metadata.Title: CVE-2021-22945 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When sending data to an MQTT server, libcurl <= 7.73.0 and 7.78.0 could in some circumstances erroneously keep a pointer to an already freed memory area and both use that again in a subsequent call to send data and also free it *again*.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-22945` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm7
libcurl3 - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm7
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm7
libcurl3-nss - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: alexmurray> MQTT sending support is only present in curl >= 7.70 - see Message-ID: <nycvar.QRO.7.76.2109061032590.1742@fvyyl>

criterions.comment: curl package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm7').
